title: Shy to Bold Lines
prompt: Fill the page with lines that start very shy and slowly become bold and confident. Begin with tiny, quiet lines and let them grow as you move across the page.
tip: If you get stuck, repeat the same line again but slightly bigger or darker.

title: Lines That Avoid Each Other
prompt: Draw many lines on the page that try very hard not to touch each other. Let them curve, bend, or change direction to avoid contact.
tip: When two lines get close, slow down and decide where one of them should escape.

title: One Line, Many Moods
prompt: Using one continuous line, draw a path that changes mood as it moves across the page: calm, excited, tired, angry, relaxed.
tip: Think about how speed and pressure can show emotion.

title: Restless Line
prompt: Draw a line that can never stay still. Let it wander, loop back, and change direction often.
tip: Do not plan the pathâ€”decide only the next small move.

title: Crowded Page
prompt: Slowly fill the page with lines until it feels crowded, then carefully add a few more without covering everything.
tip: Leave small breathing spaces between some lines.

title: Blind Object Drawing
prompt: Choose an object in front of you. Draw it without looking at your paper, keeping your eyes only on the object.
tip: Move your hand slowly and do not erase.

title: One Continuous Shoe
prompt: Draw your shoe using one continuous line without lifting your pen or pencil.
tip: If you make a mistake, turn it into part of the drawing.

title: Big Object, Small Page
prompt: Draw an object so large that it cannot fully fit on the page.
tip: Let parts of the object go off the edge of the paper.

title: Inside Spaces Only
prompt: Draw an object by focusing only on the inside shapes and spaces. Do not draw the outer edge.
tip: Look carefully for holes, gaps, and overlaps.

title: Fast Then Slow
prompt: Draw the same object twice. First very quickly, then again very slowly on the same page.
tip: Notice how the two drawings feel different.

title: Almost Falling
prompt: Draw a person who is about to lose balance but has not fallen yet.
tip: Focus on the angle of the body, not details.

title: Running Late
prompt: Draw a person running because they are late for something important.
tip: Use long lines to show speed.

title: Heavy Object
prompt: Draw a person carrying something very heavy.
tip: Let the body bend or lean to show weight.

title: Stretching Body
prompt: Draw a person stretching their body as far as possible.
tip: Exaggerate the stretch.

title: Sneaking Quietly
prompt: Draw a person trying to move quietly without making noise.
tip: Think about careful foot placement.

title: Object With a Secret
prompt: Draw a normal object, then add one hidden feature that makes it special.
tip: The secret does not have to be realistic.

title: Living Backpack
prompt: Draw a backpack as if it were alive.
tip: Give it posture or expression.

title: Impossible Tool
prompt: Design a tool that does something impossible.
tip: Start with a real tool, then change one part.

title: Classroom Creature
prompt: Draw a creature that secretly lives in your classroom.
tip: Think about where it hides.

title: Object Mash-Up
prompt: Combine two ordinary objects into one new invention.
tip: Let both objects be clearly visible.
